utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Who wants French toast?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I’ll have some!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Good, me too. Eggs and milk are in the fridge. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oww!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What’s the matter honey?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don’t know, my hand feels weird. I guess it’s because, I’m engaged! How long before it starts getting annoying?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It starts?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, so let’s get started on the wedding plans!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Already?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, we got a lot to do! We gotta think about the flowers, the caterers, the music…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I got some thoughts on that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh wait Chandler, too many cooks…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Take from me, as the groom all you have to do is show up and try to say the right name.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What in God’s name is that?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my God, the wedding book?! I haven’t seen that since the forth grade!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This baby has got everything. Take y’know, locations for instance. First, organized alphabetically, then geographically, then by square footage.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That is so smart! Break it off. Break it off now.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And that should conclusively prove that I had the idea for Jurassic Park first! Now let’s take a look at…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe, oh my God! Wh-wh-what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I need to talk to you, it’s pretty urgent. It’s about Monica and Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my God! Of course, of course. Umm, would you please excuse me for a moment? Umm, do you know each other’s hometowns? Why don’t you… Wh-what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, umm, not much. But, I was just thinking that since those guys just got engaged that maybe it would be nice if they had some privacy, y’know? So, could I just move in with you for a couple days?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Umm, okay, yeah, sure. But wh-what’s wrong with Monica and Chandler?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Nothing—Why?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe, you said it was urgent!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yeah it is! I’m going to the movies and it starts in like five minutes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Do you realize I have a classroom full of students?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry. I’m so rude. Does anyone want to come to the movies?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, so I haven’t cleared the budget with my parents yet, but tell me how this is for music.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right umm, a string quartet for the procession.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: A jazz trio for cocktails. The Bay City Rollers for dancing. Wait, that was from my sixth grade wedding.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, you couldn’t get them anyway. Ian doesn’t plan anymore and Derrick… And Derrick is a name I shouldn’t know.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Mon, do you have another pillow? Y’know, something a little snugglyer?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why are you napping over here instead of over at your place?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, the duck…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! The duck?! What the hell did the damn duck do now?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, well he did not get sick somewhere in there and it was immediately found and properly cleaned up!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Now, do I get to look at this book or is it just for people who are actually involved in the wedding?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Of course you can look at it! Yeah, I want your opinion too!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Here you go! What do you think about centerpieces?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Centerpieces!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah! Roses or Lilies?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Definitely roses. Well, I just think they’re a little more weddingy. But Lilies are the clear choice.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God! It’s like one mind.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh-huh!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Guys! Guys!! You gotta let me nap! Ugh, I’m gonna get cranky!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, there is a perfectly good couch across the hall!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes it is perfectly good, and it is not one of the places the duck got sick!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, I’m gonna go!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Now Joey, what did the duck do?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know! But he did not eat your face cream!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey little buddy, how are you feeling? What the hell is in that face cream? That’s so soft. Pillowcases! Zelda looked at the chimney sweep. Her father, the vicar… The vicar? …wouldn’t be home for hours. Her loins were burning. She threw caution to the wind and reached out and grabbed his… Whoa! Whoa-ho-ho-ho! This is a dirty book!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, Phoebe…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh Ross, hi.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I’m with a client right now.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, let’s talk outside.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe, you can’t massage people in my apartment!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What’s the big deal? I did it at Monica and Chandler’s!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And they knew about it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, well Ross, what is this really about?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, this is my home and I want to be able to come and go whenever I want!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I will find someplace else to do the rest of my appointments. I just don’t know what the big deal is!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The big deal is I don’t want naked, greasy strangers in my apartment when I want to kick back with a puzzle—beer! Cold beer.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey Joey, what ‘cha doing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sweepin’. Why? Turn you on?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Huh. What if I was sweeping a chimney?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, did you my face cream?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Where are you going? The vicar won’t be home for hours.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, where did you learn that word?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Where do you think, Zelda?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You found my book?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah I did!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, what-what are you doing going into my bedroom?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, look I’m sorry, I went in there to take a nap and I know I shouldn’t have, but you got porn!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey-hey, y’know what? I don’t care! I’m not ashamed of my book. There’s nothing with a woman enjoying a little…erotica. It’s just a healthy expression of female sexuality, which by the way, you will never understand.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You got porn!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Hi, is uh Phoebe here?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh no-no, she-she’s out for the night.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Ohh great.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Can I, can I help you with something?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know. Are you a masseur?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes I am.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Great! Dad! Thank you so much, I’ll be back to pick him up in an hour.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: So Chandler, you’re parents must’ve been thrilled when you told them you were engaged.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I should probably call them.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I remember when we first got engaged.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t think I ever heard that story.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh dad, really you don’t need to…

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Well, I’d gotten Judy pregnant. I still don’t know that happened.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: You don’t know how that happened?! Your dog thought my diaphragm was a chew toy!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What a sweet story.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, at least you’re not hearing it for the first time at your fifth grade Halloween party.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: What?! They wanted a scary story!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Anyway, we’re really excited about our wedding plans, and well I guess pretty soon we’ll be making a big withdrawal from the Monica wedding fund. What?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: You tell her Jack, I can’t do it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What happened? You still have the Monica wedding fund don’t you?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: We have it. Only now, we call it the beach house.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don’t believe you spent my wedding fund on the beach house!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: We’re sorry honey, but we just assumed if you got married after you turned 30 you’d pay for it yourself.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You bought the beach house when I was 23!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Which means you had seven years of beach fun and you can’t put a price on that sweetie.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: We really do feel bad about this though.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: We started saving again when you were dating Richard and then that went to hell, so we redid the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What about when I started dating Chandler?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Well it was Chandler! We didn’t think he’d ever propose!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Clearly I did not start drinking enough at the start of the meal.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can’t believe it! That there is no money for my wedding?!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: We might still have some money, if your father didn’t think it was a good idea to sell ice over the Internet.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: It seemed like such a simple idea.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Stupid Jack, the word is stupid.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: All right, enough! I don’t want to hear about it anymore! Good luck, Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay! Now, I’m going to touch you. Ohh, that’s soft.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can’t believe this. Do you think that your parents could help pay for it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t know, my mother spent most of her money on her fourth wedding. She’s saving the rest for her divorce. And any extra cash my father has he saves for his yearly trips to Dollywood.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well what happened at dinner?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: My parents spent the money for our wedding!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: My God! What did you order?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wait, but there’s no money! Well this is terrible! You guys are gonna have to get married in like a, rec. center!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Honey, it’s gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! No it’s not! It’s not gonna be okay! It sucks! No swing band! No lilies!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, y’know what? It’s gonna be okay. I mean you don’t have to have this rustic Italian feast. Y’know? And-and you don’t need, you don’t need this custom-made, empire waisted, duchess, satin gown; you can wear off the rack.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, it really is gonna be okay. The important thing is that we love each other and that we’re gonna get married.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Do you even understand what off the rack means?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Look, why don’t you just pay for it yourself?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How? I don’t have any money.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I have some.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How much?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, close to…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Whoa!!! Are you kidding me?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well what?! How-how much is it?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s enough for wedding scenario eight.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh! Really?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How great are you, you little saver?! I mean, the-the amount you have is exactly the budget of my dream wedding!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, you guys are so made for each other.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, you’re not suggesting that we spend all of the money on the wedding?

utterance.speaker: Rachel and Monica
utterance.content: Ah, yeah!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, come on, I’ve been saving this money for six years and I kinda had some of it earmarked for the future, not just for a party.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! Hello, Mr. Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This is the most special day of our lives.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, I realize that honey, but I’m not gonna spend all of the money on one party.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey, umm I-I love you, but umm, if you call our wedding a party one more time, you may not get invited. Okay? Listen, we could always earn more money, okay? But uh, we’re only gonna get married once.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, I understand, but I have to put my foot down. Okay? The answer is no.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You-you’re gonna have to put your foot down?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, I am!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow, money and a firm hand. Finally a Chandler I can get on board with.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Rach.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Rach, do you smell smoke?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-huh, I get it, smoke, chimney, chimney sweep, very funny, ha-ha.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No-no-no, I’m serious. You don’t smell it? Something’s on fire.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well no, I don’t smell anything.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, y’know what? It’s probably just your burnin’ loins.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, what are you guys, what are you guys talking about?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Nothing!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Damn, this coffee’s cold! Hey Rach, do you mind if I heat this up on your loins?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know, I can not believe you told him, Joey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So I guess you bought that book after we broke up huh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh-huh, yeah I did, because I wore out my first copy when I was with you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah, yeah? Well uh, when we were going out, I read tons of porno magazines! ‘Sup?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ross! How could you do that to an old man?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Excuse me ladies. I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: My massage client, Arthur? His daughter called and said that some guy that worked for me gave him a really weird massage this afternoon.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I gave him an extremely professional massage!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: He said you poked at him with wooden spoons.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, so it wasn’t uh, a traditional massage. But I did give him accu-pressure with a pair of chopsticks. And, and I gently exfoliated him with, with a mop.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, he’s never coming back! Okay? You just cost me eight dollars a week!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, y’know what? This is your fault! You’re the one that didn’t move his-his appointment.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, it’s my fault?! You didn’t have to massage him! You could’ve sent him away! You could’ve not rolled Tonka trucks up and down his back!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: He said he liked that!! Oh you’re right, you’re right. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude, what are you massaging an old man for?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: His daughter was hot.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Gotcha.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Listen umm, I’ve been thinking, it’s not fair for me to ask you to spend all of your money on our wedding. I mean, you work, you work really hard for that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ehh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Eh, you work for that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, I thought about it too, and I’m sorry. I think we should spend all of the money on the wedding.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You do?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m putting my foot down. Yeah look, when I proposed I told you that I would do anything to make you happy, and if having the perfect wedding makes you happy then, then that’s what we’re gonna do.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, you’re so sweet. Oh, but wait, what about our, what about the future and stuff?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Eh, forget about the future and stuff! So we only have two kids, y’know? We’ll pick our favorite and that one will get to go to college.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You thought about that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How many kids were we gonna have?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh, four, a boy, twin girls and another boy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What else did you think about?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, stuff like where’d we live, y’know? Like a small place outside the city, where our kids could learn to ride their bikes and stuff. Y’know, we could have a cat that had a bell on it’s collar and we could hear it every time it ran through the little kitty door. Of course, we’d have an apartment over the garage where Joey could grow old.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know what? I-I don’t want a big, fancy wedding.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sure you do.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, I want everything you just said. I want a marriage.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I love you so much.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I love you. Hey listen umm, when, when you were talkin’ about our future you said cat, but you meant dog right.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah, totally!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh good.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hello, Zelda.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Who are you supposed to be?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The vicar!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Do you even know what a vicar is?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Like a goalie, right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. Look Joey, it’s enough all right?! You keep making these stupid jokes and this sleazy innuendoes and it’s—I’m not—it’s just not funny anymore!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, I’m sorry. Rach I—Rach I’m sorry. Okay? I’m sorry! Maybe I can make up for it by, taking you roughly in the barn.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right! Y’know what? That’s it! You wanna do it?! Let’s do it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s right, I wanna do it with you! I’ve been trying to fight it, but you just said all the right things.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I-I-I-I did?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! Ohh, I’ve been waitin’ so long to get on that body!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This body?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah that’s right! Come on Joey; sex me up!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey-hey, you’re startin’ to sound like the butcher’s wife there in-in chapter seven.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, come on now, don’t keep me waiting. Get those clothes off! But, I would keep that helmet on because you’re in for a rough ride!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t want to, I’m scared.
